data.content:
noun
[singular] the things that are done at the end of something (such as an event or process) :the final part of something
the windup of the negotiations
baseball :the movements that a pitcher makes before the ball is thrown
He went into the/his windup, then threw the pitch.
a pitcher with an unusual windup
wind-up Brit informal :something done or said in usually a joking way to make someone annoyed or upset
Her brother's act was just a wind-up to get her angry. - see also wind up at 2wind
adjective
always used before a noun
having a motor that is given power when someone turns a handle
windup toys
She has an old windup record player in her attic.
